frameDefinitions: In this frame a Deformer deforms a Patient possibly against a Resistant_surface such that it undergoes a shape-change from its canonical or original shape into the Configuration, a new shape.
The Authorities put a Prisoner in Prison as punishment for an Offense.
An Agent affects a Patient in such a way that the Patient (or some Subregion of the Patient) ends up in a non-canonical state.
A Fire burns Fuel, resulting in damage and possibly complete destruction of the Fuel.
An Agent suddenly and often violently separates the Whole_patient into two or more smaller Pieces, resulting in the Whole_patient no longer existing as such.
A Destroyer (a conscious entity) or Cause (an event, or an entity involved in such an event) affects the Patient negatively so that the Patient no longer exists.
frameExamples: Ellen <t>crumpled</t> the paper into a ball.
US Drug Researcher <t>Imprisoned</t> for FDA Fraud.
A fire that started on Saturday afternoon, the High Glade Fire - located on the Mendocino National Forest's Upper Lake Ranger District - continued to <t>burn</t> actively on Sunday.
He <t>ripped</t> <t>up</t> the letter faster than you can say 'Jack Robbins'. INI
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Deformer</fen> is the one who does the reshaping.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity acted on and that undergoes a change.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is an animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
A state that holds of the <fen>Patient</fen> or a relation that holds among the constituent parts of the <fen>Patient</fen> as a result of the arranging action.
The role <fen>Time</fen> identifies when the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The person who is confined in a penal institution.
The <fen>Prison</fen>  within which the <fen>Prisoner</fen> comes to be confined.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> are the institution or actors carrying out the imprisonment.
The time when the imprisonment happens.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Prisoner</fen> is kept.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the damage to the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The entity which is affected by the <fen>Agent</fen> so that it is damaged.
An event which leads to the damage of the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> damages the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the location of the scene where a <fen>Agent</fen> damages a <fen>Patient</fen>.

The total material currently involved in combustion, including both the parts of the <fen>Fuel</fen> currently undergoing chemical alteration and the partially ionized gas that results from this process.
The entity that is undergoing rapid chemical alteration leading to damage or destruction.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fire</fen> is burning.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Fire</fen> is burning.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> being broken into <fen>Pieces</fen>.
The entity which is destroyed by the <fen>Agent</fen> and that ends up broken into <fen>Pieces</fen>.
The fragments of the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> that result from the <fen>Agent</fen>'s action.
An event which leads to the fragmentation of the <fen>Whole_patient</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> breaks up the <fen>Whole_patient</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> breaks the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> into pieces.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the <fen>Patient</fen>'s destruction.
The entity which is destroyed by the <fen>Destroyer</fen>.
The event or entity which is responsible for the destruction of the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Destroyer</fen> destroys the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Destroyer</fen> destroys the <fen>Patient</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The lieutenant</fex> crushed it angrily with his boot before looking back at Hencke.
Jack plucked the flower out of his morning coat and closed his fist slowly over it , crushing <fex>it</fex> into a pulp.
<fex>The strong winds</fex> deformed the structure of the outhouse.
The lieutenant crushed it angrily with his boot <fex>before looking back at Hencke</fex>.
<fex>Man</fex> Falsely Imprisoned for 24 Years Seeks Damages
When she returned, <fex>the Chaoyang Town government authorities</fex> imprisoned her for 5 days.
<fex>The crash</fex> dented my car pretty bad.
<fex>I and I alone</fex> can shatter the gem and break the curse.
Shattering someone's confidence is a little different than shattering <fex>a dish</fex>.
I smashed the toy boat <fex>to flinders</fex>.
<fex>The subsequent explosions</fex> leveled most downtown office buildings.
